what: Branding for the Washington Soil Health Initiative
title: Branding for the Washington Soil Health Initiative
text: Inspired branding R packages glitr, ratlas, nmfspalette, washi provides color palettes themes consistent Washington Soil Health Initiative (WaSHI) branding.

title: Branding for the Washington Soil Health Initiative
text: can install development version washi GitHub :

title: Setup a color palette — palette_setup
text: Choose desired number colors whether colors reversed.

title: Setup a color palette — palette_setup
text: palette Character name palette palettes_washi. See names(palettes_washi) list available palettes. n Number colors palette. reverse Boolean indicating whether palette reversed. Default FALSE.

title: View a WaSHI palette — palette_view
text: palette Character name palette palettes_washi. See names(palettes_washi) list available palettes. n Number colors palette. reverse Boolean indicating whether palette reversed. Default FALSE.

title: WaSHI color palettes — palettes_washi
code: # List names of available palettes names(palettes_washi) #> [1] "standard"        "main"            "accent"          "green_highlight" #> [5] "red_highlight"   "gold_highlight"  "green_gradient"  "blue_gradient"   #> [9] "red_gradient"     # Get hex codes from a palette using dollar `$name` or double bracket # `[["name"]]` operators for extracting list elements palettes_washi$standard #>     green      blue       red      gold      gray    ltgray       tan     cream  #> "#023b2c" "#335c67" "#a60f2d" "#fcb040" "#3e3d3d" "#7C7979" "#ccc29c" "#F2F0E6"   palettes_washi[["green_gradient"]] #> [1] "#023B2C" "#1C4F40" "#376355" "#51776A" "#6C8B7E" "#879F93" "#A2B3A8" #> [8] "#BCC7BC"  # Extract a color from the standard WaSHI palette palettes_washi[["standard"]][["green"]] #> [1] "#023b2c"

what: Scales for plotting with washi palettes — scale_color_washi
title: Scales for plotting with washi palettes — scale_color_washi
Scales for plotting with washi palettes — scale_color_washi
code: scale_color_washi(   palette = "main",   reverse = FALSE,   aesthetics = c("color", "fill"),   discrete = TRUE,   ... )

title: Scales for plotting with washi palettes — scale_color_washi
text: palette Character name palette palettes_washi. See names(palettes_washi) list available palettes. reverse Boolean indicating whether palette reversed. Default FALSE. aesthetics Character string vector character strings listing name(s) aesthetic(s) scale works . Defaults c("color", "fill"), applies palette color fill aesthetics time. discrete Boolean indicating whether color aesthetic discrete . Default TRUE. ... Additional arguments passed discrete_scale() scale_color_gradientn(), used respectively discrete TRUE FALSE

title: Scales for plotting with washi palettes — scale_color_washi
text: ScaleContinuous ScaleDiscrete object can added ggplot object

title: Scales for plotting with washi palettes — scale_color_washi
code: library(ggplot2)  # Discrete scale ggplot(iris, aes(Sepal.Width, Sepal.Length, color = Species)) +   geom_point(size = 4) +   theme_minimal() +   scale_color_washi("main")   # Continuous scale ggplot(diamonds) +   geom_point(aes(x = carat, y = price, color = price)) +   theme_minimal() +   scale_color_washi("green_gradient", reverse = TRUE, discrete = FALSE)
